page.title: 12RUDGWICK VILLAGE- CHANGES(1)
page.content: Rudgwick's{LINEAR}arrangement has re- mained basically unchanged for{DECADES but{BUILDINGS}and{FEATURES}around and along the main roads have seen several {ALTERATIONS.}The old{RAILWAY LINE}runs {N.W.- S.E.}across Rudgwick and dates back to the{VICTORIAN ERA.}For{100 YRS {(1865-1965)}the line transported{GOODS &{PASSENGERS}from{HORSHAM - GUILDFORD. The railway line now provides the{PUB- {LIC}with a{BRIDLEWAY}and a{NATUREWALK/ {FOOTPATH}called the{DOWNS-LINK}which links footpaths from the{NORTH}&{SOUTH {DOWNS.}The{STATION BUILDINGS}have also since been{CONVERTED}into an area with a{BLOCK}of{3-STOREY FLATS,}a childrens {PLAYGROUND}and on the old station site itself, the{HEALTH CENTRE.}Adjacent to this is land which was formerly a{SITE of a{RIFLE RANGE}but now is{OCCUPIED by a{GARAGE FORECOURT, HOUSING ESTATE, and a{BRITISH TELECOM EXCHANGE.
